20101229070611.000|20101229070613.000|CC1|RED TAGGED.

20101229070621.000|20101229070624.000|CC1|ARE FILLING AND STACKING 100,000
20101229070624.000|20101229070626.000|CC1|SANDBAGS, GIVING THEM TO        
20101229070626.000|20101229070628.000|CC1|RESIDENTS AND SOME ADVICE.      
20101229070628.000|20101229070630.000|CC1|>> YOU NEED TO LOOK WHERE WATER

20101229070639.000|20101229070641.000|CC1|ALL OF HIGHLAND IS A SANDBAG.   
20101229070641.000|20101229070642.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AS ALL OF HIGHLAND 
20101229070642.000|20101229070644.000|CC1|WAITS FOR THE RAIN.             
20101229070644.000|20101229070647.000|CC1|>> SO WE ARE WAITING AND        
20101229070647.000|20101229070649.000|CC1|WATCHING, OF COURSE, IN THE     
20101229070649.000|20101229070650.000|CC1|11:00 HOUR AND OVERNIGHT.       
20101229070650.000|20101229070652.000|CC1|THE MAYOR SAID IT COULD TAKE UP 
20101229070652.000|20101229070656.000|CC1|TO ONE YEAR TO CLEAN UP THE MESS

20101229070709.000|20101229070711.000|CC1|IT IS IMPORTANT TO ALL OF US THE
20101229070711.000|20101229070714.000|CC1|STORM THAT IS COMING IN.

20101229070726.000|20101229070728.000|CC1|>> THE HILLSIDES IN THE STATION 
20101229070728.000|20101229070730.000|CC1|FIRE AREA HAVE HELD.            
20101229070730.000|20101229070733.000|CC1|THE DAILY AIR PATROL HAS BEEN   
20101229070733.000|20101229070735.000|CC1|TAKING PHOTOS THAT COULD SHOW   
20101229070735.000|20101229070736.000|CC1|ANY SIGNS OF WEAKNESS.          
20101229070736.000|20101229070739.000|CC1|THEY HAVE NOT FOUND EROSION OR  
20101229070739.000|20101229070740.000|CC1|GROUND MOVEMENT.                
20101229070740.000|20101229070743.000|CC1|CLEARS HAVE CREWED OUT DEBRIS   
20101229070743.000|20101229070748.000|CC1|BASINS TO ASSURE GOOD DRAINAGE  
20101229070748.000|20101229070749.000|CC1|AND FEEL CONFIDENT THEY WILL    
20101229070749.000|20101229070753.000|CC1|HOLD WITH THE APPROACHING STORM.
20101229070753.000|20101229070755.000|CC1|>> A LOT OF RESIDENTS BELIEVE IF
20101229070755.000|20101229070758.000|CC1|THE SUN IS OUT THE HILLSIDES ARE
20101229070758.000|20101229070758.000|CC1|OKAY.                           
20101229070758.000|20101229070759.000|CC1|THAT IS NOT TRUE.               
20101229070759.000|20101229070801.000|CC1|WITH THE WINTER SEASON COMING   
20101229070801.000|20101229070803.000|CC1|DRYING OUT COMPLETELY IS NOT    
20101229070803.000|20101229070804.000|CC1|GOING TO HAPPEN.                
20101229070804.000|20101229070806.000|CC1|>> IF YOU LIVE IN A HILLSIDE    
20101229070806.000|20101229070808.000|CC1|AREA ENGINEERS SAY THE WARNING  
20101229070808.000|20101229070811.000|CC1|SIGNS ARE OBVIOUS, A STRANGE    
20101229070811.000|20101229070814.000|CC1|NOISE MAY HAPPEN SUDDENLY IN THE
20101229070814.000|20101229070814.000|CC1|DAY OR NIGHT.                   
20101229070814.000|20101229070816.000|CC1|THE SUDDEN APPEARANCE OF DIRT   
20101229070816.000|20101229070818.000|CC1|AND ROCKS IN THE ROD SIGNS OF   
20101229070818.000|20101229070820.000|CC1|SOMETHING WORSE ON THE WRAGGE.  
20101229070820.000|20101229070824.000|CC1|THIS IS WHAT CAN HAPPEN.        
20101229070824.000|20101229070826.000|CC1|THIS IS IN SAN DIEGO.           
20101229070826.000|20101229070828.000|CC1|A BLUFF GAVE WAY LEAVING A      
20101229070828.000|20101229070831.000|CC1|GAPING HOLE AND A HOME IN A     
20101229070831.000|20101229070832.000|CC1|PRECARIOUS POSITION.            
20101229070832.000|20101229070834.000|CC1|THE RAIN-SATURATED BLUFF BEGAN  
20101229070834.000|20101229070837.000|CC1|TO CRUMBLE ON FRIDAY.

20101229070838.000|20101229070840.000|CC1|THE ENTIRE THING TO COME DOWN.  
20101229070840.000|20101229070936.000|SEG|Type=Story
20101229070840.000|20101229070842.000|CC1|>>> AIRLINES ARE SLOWLY         
20101229070842.000|20101229070846.000|CC1|BEGINNING TO UNTANGLE WHAT THE  
20101229070846.000|20101229070849.000|CC1|HUGE BLIZZARD LEFT BEHIND ON THE
20101229070849.000|20101229070850.000|CC1|EAST COAST.                     
20101229070850.000|20101229070852.000|CC1|TRAVELERS ARE STARTING TO FIND  
20101229070852.000|20101229070854.000|CC1|FLIGHTS HOME.                   
20101229070854.000|20101229070856.000|CC1|OTHERS CONTINUE BEING FRUSTRATED
20101229070856.000|20101229070859.000|CC1|BECAUSE MANY FLIGHTS ARE        
20101229070859.000|20101229070900.000|CC1|OVERBOOKED.                     
20101229070900.000|20101229070902.000|CC1|THE THREE MAJOR AIRPORTS IN NEW 
20101229070902.000|20101229070904.000|CC1|YORK ARE OPEN FOR BUSINESS AFTER
20101229070904.000|20101229070906.000|CC1|1, 600 FLIGHTS WERE CANCELED.   
20101229070906.000|20101229070908.000|CC1|AS FOR THE OVERBOOKING THAT     
20101229070908.000|20101229070910.000|CC1|HAPPENED BECAUSE PLANES WERE    
20101229070910.000|20101229070912.000|CC1|MOVED OUT OF THE NEW YORK AREA  
20101229070912.000|20101229070913.000|CC1|BEFORE THE STORM HIT.           
20101229070913.000|20101229070915.000|CC1|THIS PHOTO SHOWS WHAT CAN       
20101229070915.000|20101229070915.000|CC1|HAPPEN.                         
20101229070915.000|20101229070917.000|CC1|THIS HAPPENED AT A SKI RESORT IN
20101229070917.000|20101229070922.000|CC1|MAINE WHEN THE CABLE ON THE SKI 
20101229070922.000|20101229070923.000|CC1|LIFT DERAILED.                  
20101229070923.000|20101229070924.000|CC1|EIGHT PEOPLE WERE INJURED.      
20101229070924.000|20101229070926.000|CC1|MOST OF THE INJURIES WERE NOT   
20101229070926.000|20101229070929.000|CC1|SERIOUS EVEN THOUGH THE SKIERS  
20101229070929.000|20101229070931.000|CC1|FELL 20 TO 50 FEET.             
20101229070931.000|20101229070934.000|CC1|THE SKI LIFT WAS GETTING OLD AND
20101229070934.000|20101229070936.000|CC1|SCHEDULED TO BE REPLACED SOON.  
20101229070936.000|20101229070958.000|SEG|Type=Story
20101229070936.000|20101229070939.000|CC1|>>> ALSO AT OUR LOCAL MOUNTAINS,
20101229070939.000|20101229070941.000|CC1|A 24-YEAR-OLD SNOWBOARDER WAS   
20101229070941.000|20101229070944.000|CC1|KILLED LAST NIGHT WHEN HE HIT A 
20101229070944.000|20101229070948.000|CC1|TREE IN THE SKI RESORT OF       
20101229070948.000|20101229070948.000|CC1|WRIGHTWOOD.                     
20101229070948.000|20101229070950.000|CC1|THE SNOWBOARDER WAS NOT WEARING 
20101229070950.000|20101229070952.000|CC1|A SAFETY HELMET.
